intro: Psychotria urniformis, commonly known as the "violet psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, violet-colored flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a mild, slightly bitter taste. Psychotria urniformis is often found in association with other epiphytic plants and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
